Judul: Oxygen-Induced Doping as a Degradation Mechanism in HighlyEfficient Organic Solar Cells
Abstrak: Despite tremendous advances in improving the efficiency oforganic solar cells above 14%, the environmental stability of such devices remainsan essential and widely inadequately addressed challenge. Understanding theunderlying principles of device degradation is a critical step toward furtherdevelopment and commercialization of organic photovoltaics. Herein, we reporton the effect of oxygen exposure on the operation and degradation of highlyefficient PffBT4T-2OD:PC71BM photovoltaic devices. Ultrafast pump?probetransient absorption (TA) measurements and ultrasensitive photothermaldeflection spectroscopy (PDS) in combination withfield-effect transistorssuggest that oxygen-induced doping of the active layer is responsible for thesevere degradation of the photovoltaic performance. Wefind that light exposurefurther accelerates this effect without causing photo-oxidation of the materials.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Joshua A. Kress,Fabian Paulus,David Becker-Koch,Vincent Lami,Artem A. Bakulin,Yana Vaynzof
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
Kata Kunci: device stability, organicfield-effect transistors, photothermal deflection spectroscopy, transient absorption spectroscopy,organic photovoltaics, oxygen doping
